intro: Lasiostoma glabrum, commonly known as the smooth lasiostoma, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are typically smooth and glabrous. Its flowers are small, clustered in whorls, and feature showy, tubular corollas with vibrant colors. Lasiostoma glabrum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
